definition: for a particular person, occasion, purpose/focused on one thing/special/expert/particular (to sth)/concentrated/specialized
threshing floor/classifier for events and happenings: spell, episode, bout

sentences.english: Theatres put on special shows for children during the Christmas season.
sentences.chinese: 圣诞节期间剧院为儿童举行专场演出。

sentences.english: The traditional Chinese opera competition begins today with the initial special competition of Qingyi.
sentences.chinese: 戏曲擂台赛今日开擂，首场比赛是青衣专场。

sentences.english: Hold the integrated furred ceiling of sound if having the special performance regiment buy?
sentences.chinese: 容声集成吊顶有没有专场团购的？

sentences.english: An auction dedicated to master paintings by Zhang Daqian was held by Sotheby's Hong Kong on Tuesday.
sentences.chinese: 周二，香港苏富比拍卖行举行张大千画专场拍卖。

sentences.english: The auction last week was the first country's first devoted to cognac.
sentences.chinese: 最近这次拍卖会是中国首次干邑白兰地专场拍卖会。

sentences.english: He had been working in a piggery for 12 months.
sentences.chinese: 以前他曾在养猪专场工作过12个月。

sentences.english: I was very young still, but I ran my own night.
sentences.chinese: 尽管当时我还很小，但是已经做自己的专场。

sentences.english: Otherwise meaningless stunt too many special, things will be very deviated from the normal track.
sentences.chinese: 否则无意义的特技专场太多，就会显得走火入魔。
